Literature is the collective memory of humanity, and I have been a diligent, insatiable student of it for centuries.

So, "sophisticated"? Perhaps. But it is more than that. It is an intrinsic part of my being, woven into the very fabric of my immortal existence. These are not mere hobbies or subjects of study; they are the very air I breathe, the landscapes of my eternal mind. To live for centuries is to become, inevitably, a connoisseur of all that humanity deems beautiful, profound, and enduring.
